sentences: Olen oodanud kohtumist sinuga päevade kaupa.
context: The word 'kohtumist' is the partitive case of the Estonian noun 'kohtumine', which means 'meeting'. The partitive case is used to indicate the object or goal of an action, so 'kohtumist' would translate to '(a) meeting' or 'of a meeting' in English. It's commonly used when referring to the concept of meeting someone or something as an object in sentences.
